poem:
**Inheritance Deferred**

A princess's will,  
echoes of ancestry,  
entrusted treasures,  
to young hearts' fires.  
Yet in litigious shadows,  
old voices stir,  
casting doubt like a  
net over the ocean's expanse,  
cradling the dreams  
of island roots,  
as past and future collide  
in silent,  
ancient surf.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A Hawaiian princess bequeathed her inheritance to her people. The schools they set up are being sued Advocates for a private school system established to educate Native Hawaiians say a new lawsuit targeting the admissions process is an ugly attempt to ignore the wishes of a Hawaiian princess who bequeathed her inheritance to secure a brighter future for her people nearly 140 years ago. The Kamehameha schools were established in the will of Bernice Pauahi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
